metadata.title: OpenPaint Arrowhead Logic and Adjustable Size Analysis
metadata.scope: Complete analysis of arrowhead rendering logic and size adjustment mechanisms

executive-summary.overview: The OpenPaint application implements a sophisticated arrowhead rendering system with adjustable size functionality. The system supports multiple arrow styles (triangular, filled, curved) and provides automatic size scaling based on stroke width and image zoom level. However, the current implementation lacks a direct user interface control for adjusting arrow size, relying instead on automatic calculations and hardcoded default values.

key-findings.finding: Arrow size is automatically calculated based on stroke width with a minimum threshold
No direct UI control exists for users to manually adjust arrow size
Arrow size scales with image zoom level for consistent visual appearance
Multiple arrow styles are supported with different rendering approaches
Performance optimizations include pre-calculated trigonometry constants

effective-size-calculation.explanation: The system now uses truly proportional sizing. If no explicit arrowSize is set (null), it defaults to stroke width × 2. This allows arrows to be smaller than the previous 15-pixel minimum while maintaining proportional sizing relative to line thickness.

conclusion.summary: The OpenPaint arrowhead system demonstrates sophisticated rendering logic with automatic size adaptation and performance optimizations. However, it lacks user-facing controls for manual size adjustment, limiting customization capabilities. The foundation is solid and well-architected, making it straightforward to add the missing UI controls.

key-takeaways.takeaway: Arrow size is automatically calculated and scaled, but not user-adjustable
Multiple arrow styles are implemented but not exposed to users
Performance optimizations are in place for efficient rendering
Integration with stroke system is comprehensive and well-designed
Adding user controls would be a relatively straightforward enhancement
